needle: Figs are one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.
Prosciutto is one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.
Goat cheese is one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.

model_response.text:
Working for oneself, or at least working for a small group, seems
to bring a form of fulfillment, but also a risk: if you start a
startup, you'll face failure as likely as success.  How do you know
what's natural for humans?  We live in a world with the wrong
food, and a world with the wrong kind of work.  And so what does
it mean for humans to be healthy?  To be happy?  To live
naturally?  By studying the animals in their natural environments,
I think I've discovered some clues about how to do these things better.[8] <PAUSE> One of the things animals are really good at doing is being in a
group.  You see lions, elephants, wolves and other animals that work
together in groups, and they all do it very well.  They're even
better than humans.  We work in groups, but we don't know why
we work in groups, and we don't even know what the point of it
is.  I was struck by how different lions are from dogs when I first
saw them in the wild in Tanzania.  I'd seen dogs all my life,
but nothing else in Africa.  I'd just seen videos of lions before,
but they're different.  Dogs are social, but they're not like
lions.  Dogs don't herd sheep; cows run away from them.  But
lions do.  And when I was watching the lions from a safe distance
in 2008, one group of them was herding a small herd of
antelopes.  A lion was directing, a group of others doing the
herding, and the rest were standing guard.  Even with all the
danger, there was order.  A lion is a solitary hunter.[9] <PAUSE>  But a lion isn't a herder.  She was standing near the
back of the herd, not near the front.  When I watched this, she
seemed to be waiting for something, though I didn't know what.  I
later asked the guide, who'd been watching the scene, what she was
waiting for.  He said the lion was waiting for the antelopes to
spread out, so she could pounce.  This is different from how
you usually think about herding animals.
